content: After setting up my organisation on zulipchat.com and logging in on mobile, I unsubscribed from "core team", thinking I would only be unsubscribed on my mobile device so that I would not be bothered with notifications there. Instead the whole stream appears to have been removed from my view, even though I am the instance administrator, maybe it was entirely deleted because I was the only member so far. Is there a way to restore it?

You should be able to click the little settings symbol next to "STREAMS", select "all streams" and rejoin the stream.

You can configure push notifications in your Settings
Thanks @Felix (strifel)! I have already checked there. The "core team" stream that was automatically created when I created the instance is not visible there anymore.
@Dennis Schridde any user who's still on the stream can add you; if there are none, it's been deactivated and you'll likely need to find it in the "deactivated streams" UI.

What UI did you use to unsubscribe? We have plans on the webapp to add a warning before doing so, but it sounds like maybe you did this on mobile?

In any case @Greg Price we should open an issue to track the webapp-side issue.
Yes, I was using mobile. # > All Streams, and then I flipped the switch on the "core team" stream.

Where do I find that "deactivated streams" UI? In the webapp I looked into gear menu > "manage streams" , but only find "subscribed" and "all streams". In gear menu > "manage organisation" I find "deactivated users" and "default streams", but not "deactivated streams".
@Tim Abbott there already appears to be a PR implementing the additional confirmation: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/8674
That's quite old PR, here is my latest PR for showing a confirmation modal before unsubscribing from private stream #16062.
Cool, I'll try to integrate the newer one.
@Tim Abbott, where can I find the "deactivated streams UI" you mentioned?
@Dennis Schridde I think it actually doesn't exist yet -- sorry for the confusion. If you email support@zulip.com with details, the folks there can manually reactivate a stream for you.
Thanks, I did that now. For some reason I interpreted https://zulip.com/help/contact-support in a way that made me think this zulip instance is the preferred way to get in touch.
It is for questions, which resolve most support queries -- but we generally only make changes via the email support system.
Thanks for your help. Your support team was able to restore the "core team" stream successfully. :smile:
The support team are also developers that hang out in here. :wink:
